Beaufort***Stanley***Bowen

John [Beaufort], ‘3rd Earl of Somerset’, ‘Earl of Kendal', ‘1st Duke of Somerset’ (28 Aug 1443), Knight of the Garter (1440) – b. c. Apr 1404, d. 27 May 1444. Buried: Wimborne Minster Church.M. ~ 2 August 1441 Margaret Beauchamp, 'Duchess of Somerset' [de jure suo jure Baroness Beauchamp, of Bletsoe inherited the manors of Lydiard Tregoze in Wiltshire, Ashmore in Dorset and Bletsoe and Deysoe in Bedfordshire in accordance with modern doctrine, the right to any barony of Beauchamp created by summons to Parliament directed to her great- great- grandfather, Roger Beauchamp, '1st Baron Beauchamp'], [Coheir of Coyty Castle, formerly of the Turbervilles c. 1421] - b. 1 January 1405/10, of Bletsoe, Bedfordshire England, d. 3 June or 8 August 1482, Wimborne Minster, Dorest England. Buried: St. Cauthberga Churchyard, Wimborne Minster, Dorset England, on John [Beauchamp], '3rd Baron Beauchamp', of Bletsoe and wife Edith Stourton, d/o Sir John Stourton of Stourton, Wiltshire. [Margaret Beauchamp married first, 'Saint John', Sir Oliver St. John, [Sir Oliver], 'Baron St. John', of Bletso, Knight, 'Lord of Penmark' (created 1582 for Oliver St. John) - b. 1398 in Penmark, Glamorgan Wales, d. ~1437, Rouen, Duche de Normandie, France, Buried 4 March 1437, Rouen, Normandy, France s/o Sir John de St John, and Isabel Paveley d/o and heiress of Sir John Paveley and Lady Margaret Waldegrave. Ch. John St. John, Oliver St. John, Edith St. John, Mary St. John, Elizabeth St. John, Agnes St. John, Margaret St. John; M. Margaret Beauchamp married third [bylicense] 14 April 1447, Lionel de Welles, '6th Baron Welles'. Ch. John Welles, 1st Viscount Welles]Ch. Margaret Beaufort

Lady Margaret Beaufort, 'Countess of Richmond', Countess of Derby' [Beauchamp] - b. 31 May 1443, d. 29 June 1509. Ch. Henry VII [Tudor]; M. 3rd, c. 1400, Lord Henry Stafford, d. 4 Oct 1471, 2nd s/o Humphrey Stafford, '1st Duke of Buckingham'; M. 4th bfr Oct 1473, Thomas Stanley, '1st Earl of Derby'.
